member.name: T:Mindscape.WpfDiagramming.StarDiagrams.StarDiagramForceBasedLayout
member.summary: A type of that uses physics equations revolving around spring theory and particle theory to force all the nodes of a into a sutable position. The does not modify the positions of or objects within the .

member.summary: Runs this layout algorithm on the given model while making sure the given node is not affected. This is useful when the user is dragging a node.
member.param: The diagram model to apply this layout algorithm to.
The node that should not be affected by this algorithm.

member.name: M:Mindscape.WpfDiagramming.StarDiagrams.StarDiagramForceBasedLayout.Run(Mindscape.WpfDiagramming.Foundation.IDiagramModel)
member.summary: Runs the force-based layout algorithm on the given for the number of iterations defined by or until a suitable layout has been reached.
member.param: The to apply the force-based layout algorithm to.

member.name: P:Mindscape.WpfDiagramming.StarDiagrams.StarDiagramForceBasedLayout.MaxIterations
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of iterations of the algorithm within one call to the Run method.

member.name: P:Mindscape.WpfDiagramming.StarDiagrams.StarDiagramForceBasedLayout.Damping
member.summary: Gets or sets the damping of the force-based layout algorithm. This is typically between 0 - 1. The higher the value, the faster the algorithm can run. The lower the value, the more stable the algorithm will be. A relatively good value for this is 0.6f. 0.9f is ideal if the is 1.

member.name: P:Mindscape.WpfDiagramming.StarDiagrams.StarDiagramForceBasedLayout.SeparationDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance that this uses to separate different collections of objects within a diagram.

The connection point at the end of the connection that is not being moved.
